rows.IP-S41: APPLIED RESEARCH — INDUSTRY PERS: What applied organizational research looks like. What journals publish it. What's the bar.
THE FIELD
This sits at the intersection of three fields:
1. ORGANIZATIONAL DESIGN / MANAGEMENT SCIENCE
Journals: Management Science, Organization Science, Academy of Management Review
Key concept: Flash teams (Valentine & Bernstein, Stanford HAI / MIT Press 2025)
Key concept: Holacracy, DAOs, decentralized organizations
Bar: Empirical data on novel organizational forms. Case studies with measurable outcomes.
2. COLLECTIVE INTELLIGENCE / SWARM BEHAVIOR
Journals: PNAS, Nature, Science, Swarm Intelligence (Springer)
Key researchers: Nagpal (Princeton), Couzin (Max Planck), Dorigo (Brussels), Gordon (Stanford)
Key concept: Decentralized coordination producing emergent global behavior
Bar: Bridge between biological/robotic swarms and human organizational systems.
3. HUMAN-COMPUTER INTERACTION / AI-AUGMENTED WORK
Journals: CHI, CSCW, Human Computation
Key concept: AI co-pilots in collaborative work (Claude as co-pilot for flash teams)
Key concept: Crowd computing, human computation, hybrid intelligence
Bar: Novel system design + empirical evaluation.
The publishable angle: A 103-TUP coordination artifact, produced by 40-60 flash contributors
coordinated only by the artifact itself + an AI co-pilot, with zero centralized management.
That's never been documented at this scale with this level of structural detail.
COMPARABLE PUBLISHED WORK
Paper / Book
Flash Teams (MIT Press 2025)
rows.col_3: On-demand expert teams assembled via platforms, coordinated by software.
rows.col_4: We add: the Trade as coordination artifact. AI co-pilot. DAO equity. 103-model scope. Zero budget.

rows.IP-S41: APPLIED RESEARCH — INDUSTRY PERS: Kilobots: 1000 robot swarm
rows.col_3: 1,024 robots self-organizing into shapes using only local rules.
rows.col_4: We add: human agents instead of robots. Complex deliverables instead of shapes. Same local-rules principle.

rows.IP-S41: APPLIED RESEARCH — INDUSTRY PERS:
Collective Intelligence in
Animal Groups
rows.col_3: How fish/birds/insects make group decisions without central control.
rows.col_4: We add: human version. The Trade = pheromone trail. The librarian = information routing. The MC = signal amplification.

rows.IP-S41: APPLIED RESEARCH — INDUSTRY PERS: Ant Colony Optimization
rows.col_3: Algorithms inspired by ant foraging for optimization problems.
rows.col_4: We add: human foraging for talent, opportunities, and knowledge. The recruiting funnel = ant foraging trail.

rows.IP-S41: APPLIED RESEARCH — INDUSTRY PERS: The Wisdom of Crowds
rows.col_3: How groups can be smarter than individuals under right conditions.
rows.col_4: We add: structural conditions (the Trade) that enable crowd wisdom in venture creation.
